alert.note: Alert for Cross; St. Francis (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 4:59PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central St. Francis and Cross Counties through 530 PM CDT... At 459 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hickory Ridge, or 11 miles northwest of Wynne, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wynne, Parkin, Village Creek State Park, Colt, Hickory Ridge, Vanndale, Hydrick, River Front, Fitzgerald Crossing, Crow Creek, Wittsburg, Tilton, Duvall, McDonald, Brushy Lake, McElroy, Kinton, Fair Field, Ellis Chapel and Levesque. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for eastern Arkansas.
